title: 'Outrageous': Diddy lawyers on materials seized from Sean Comb's jail cell
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs's lawyers are accusing prosecutors of "outrageous government conduct" for raiding Diddy's jail cell and using seized materials in court to argue against his release on bail. Prosecutors allege that Diddy used other inmates' phone accounts to contact witnesses and orchestrate social media campaigns to influence the jury pool, violating jail rules.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs's lawyers are accusing prosecutors of "outrageous government conduct" for raiding Diddy's jail cell and using seized materials in court to argue against his release on bail. Prosecutors allege that Diddy used other inmates' phone accounts to contact witnesses and orchestrate social media campaigns to influence the jury pool, violating jail rules.

title: MAGA celebrates 'Trump effect' in Miss Universe contest: 'Had Kamala won...'
content: MAGA supporters are celebrating Denmark's Victoria Kjaer Theilvig's Miss Universe win as a victory against "wokeness" in the aftermath of Donald Trump's win in the US election. “Wokeness is officially over. This is the new Miss Universe,” one X user wrote. "Biological & objectively attractive women are allowed to win beauty pageants again. WE ARE SO BACK," Donald Trump Jr posted on X.
summary: MAGA supporters are celebrating Denmark's Victoria Kjaer Theilvig's Miss Universe win as a victory against "wokeness" in the aftermath of Donald Trump's win in the US election. “Wokeness is officially over. This is the new Miss Universe,” one X user wrote. "Biological & objectively attractive women are allowed to win beauty pageants again. WE ARE SO BACK," Donald Trump Jr posted on X.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy says govt staff are 'in tears' in prospect of 5 days work
content: A reasonable formula to fix the US government would be Milei-style cuts, on steroids, DOGE co-chief Vivek Ramaswamy said hinting at Argentina president Javier Milei's method to reduce government expenditure in which 70000 state jobs were cut. Ramaswamy earlier hinted at a cruel axing of departments that are not contributing anything and where the staff don't even come to the office and have other jobs.
summary: A reasonable formula to fix the US government would be Milei-style cuts, on steroids, DOGE co-chief Vivek Ramaswamy said hinting at Argentina president Javier Milei's method to reduce government expenditure in which 70000 state jobs were cut. Ramaswamy earlier hinted at a cruel axing of departments that are not contributing anything and where the staff don't even come to the office and have other jobs.

title: YouTuber Rosanna Pansino smokes her father's ashes because his dying wish was...
content: YouTuber Rosanna Pansino smoked her late father's ashes and revealed in her video that her father's dying wish was to that his ashes be mixed with soil to grow a marijuana plant. She revealed that she and her mother were sceptical about the wish but now after five years, they fulfilled the dream.
summary: YouTuber Rosanna Pansino smoked her late father's ashes and revealed in her video that her father's dying wish was to that his ashes be mixed with soil to grow a marijuana plant. She revealed that she and her mother were sceptical about the wish but now after five years, they fulfilled the dream.

title: Massive clash between Elon Musk and Trump aide at Mar-a-Lago dinner table. Reason is...
content: ​"At one point during what the sources describe as a 'massive blowup' and a 'huge explosion', Musk accused Epshteyn of leaking details of Trump's transition -- including personnel picks -- to the media. Epshteyn responded by telling Musk that he didn't know what he was talking about," Axios reported adding that Epshteyn had been bristling over Musk questioning the qualification of candidates proposed by Epshteyn.
summary: ​"At one point during what the sources describe as a 'massive blowup' and a 'huge explosion', Musk accused Epshteyn of leaking details of Trump's transition -- including personnel picks -- to the media. Epshteyn responded by telling Musk that he didn't know what he was talking about," Axios reported adding that Epshteyn had been bristling over Musk questioning the qualification of candidates proposed by Epshteyn.

title: Donald Trump reacts to meeting 'Morning Joe' hosts, says he's not looking to destroy people
content: Donald Trump reacted to his interaction with the Morning Joe hosts of MSNBC and said he looks ​forward to such meetings with other media houses too. "I received a call from Joe Scarborough requesting a meeting for him and Mika, and I agreed that it would be a good thing if such meeting took place," Trump said. "Many things were discussed, and I very much appreciated the fact that they wanted to have open communication," he said. "In many ways, it’s too bad that it wasn’t done long ago."
summary: Donald Trump reacted to his interaction with the Morning Joe hosts of MSNBC and said he looks ​forward to such meetings with other media houses too. "I received a call from Joe Scarborough requesting a meeting for him and Mika, and I agreed that it would be a good thing if such meeting took place," Trump said. "Many things were discussed, and I very much appreciated the fact that they wanted to have open communication," he said. "In many ways, it’s too bad that it wasn’t done long ago."

title: AI Wars: Why Elon Musk and Sam Altman fell out over OpenAI
content: Flashback to 2015. Sam Altman, fresh off his Y Combinator successes, and Elon Musk, already a global tech demigod, came together to launch OpenAI. It was a big idea: build artificial general intelligence (AGI) and make sure it didn’t turn into Skynet. OpenAI was supposed to be open, transparent, and committed to benefiting all of humanity. Musk, ever the prophet of doom, often compared AI to summoning a demon. Altman, less dramatic but equally ambitious, saw OpenAI as the antidote to unchecked corporate control of AI.
summary: Flashback to 2015. Sam Altman, fresh off his Y Combinator successes, and Elon Musk, already a global tech demigod, came together to launch OpenAI. It was a big idea: build artificial general intelligence (AGI) and make sure it didn’t turn into Skynet. OpenAI was supposed to be open, transparent, and committed to benefiting all of humanity. Musk, ever the prophet of doom, often compared AI to summoning a demon. Altman, less dramatic but equally ambitious, saw OpenAI as the antidote to unchecked corporate control of AI.

title: RFK Jr's cousin Caroline calls his idea 'dangerous': 'I grew up with him. Others are just...'
content: Calling his anti-vaccine ideas dangerous, Caroline said, "I don't think most Americans share his views. I would say that our family is united in terms of our support for the public health sector and infrastructure and has the greatest admiration for the medical profession in our country. Bobby Kennedy has got a different set of views."
summary: Calling his anti-vaccine ideas dangerous, Caroline said, "I don't think most Americans share his views. I would say that our family is united in terms of our support for the public health sector and infrastructure and has the greatest admiration for the medical profession in our country. Bobby Kennedy has got a different set of views."

title: Matt Gaetz, Trump's attorney general pick, accused of participating in 10 sex parties
content: Lawyer Joel Leppard representing two women who already testified before the House Ethics Committee said his clients informed the probe panel that drugs were consumed at those sex parties. One of the women claimed to have seen Gaetz having sex with an underage friend up against a games table. Leppard said he will make media appearances revealing details of those orgies so that the committee releases the report.
summary: Lawyer Joel Leppard representing two women who already testified before the House Ethics Committee said his clients informed the probe panel that drugs were consumed at those sex parties. One of the women claimed to have seen Gaetz having sex with an underage friend up against a games table. Leppard said he will make media appearances revealing details of those orgies so that the committee releases the report.

title: What! 'Morning Joe' hosts visit Trump at Mar-a-Lago: 'We are not here to normalize him'
content: Morning Joe co-hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski made their shocking announcement that they met with former President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago, marking their first encounter in seven years. It was a patch-up meeting as the hosts said they wanted to restart communications but faced massive outrage on social media. Morning Joe is dead, users wrote on X after today's Morning Joe.
summary: Morning Joe co-hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski made their shocking announcement that they met with former President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago, marking their first encounter in seven years. It was a patch-up meeting as the hosts said they wanted to restart communications but faced massive outrage on social media. Morning Joe is dead, users wrote on X after today's Morning Joe.

title: Who is Yasir Al-Rumayyan, the 'mystery man' sitting beside Trump at UFC fight?
content: The man, termed as the 'mystery man' in some of the videos doing rounds on social media, was Yasir Al-Rumayyan, the head of Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Fox News reported. Al-Rumayyan also chairs Saudi Aramco and the English Premier's Newcastle United Football Club. The Washington Post reported that Trump met key Saydi figures in recent days. He played a round of golf with PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan on Friday.
summary: The man, termed as the 'mystery man' in some of the videos doing rounds on social media, was Yasir Al-Rumayyan, the head of Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Fox News reported. Al-Rumayyan also chairs Saudi Aramco and the English Premier's Newcastle United Football Club. The Washington Post reported that Trump met key Saydi figures in recent days. He played a round of golf with PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan on Friday.

title: As Ann Selzer exits election polling, Donald Trump says 'she knew exactly what she was doing'
content: As Ann Selzer announced that she would not be doing polling for election any more after her wrong prediction in Iowa that kept Kamala Harris ahead of Donald Trump, President-elect Trump said there should be an investigation into her polling that 'caused great distrust and uncertainty at a very critical time'. Trump said she Ann Selzer knew exactly what she was doing.
summary: As Ann Selzer announced that she would not be doing polling for election any more after her wrong prediction in Iowa that kept Kamala Harris ahead of Donald Trump, President-elect Trump said there should be an investigation into her polling that 'caused great distrust and uncertainty at a very critical time'. Trump said she Ann Selzer knew exactly what she was doing.

title: Apollo, the stray dog scaling Egypt’s pyramids, becomes viral sensation
content: Apollo, a stray dog living at the Giza Pyramids, became an overnight sensation after a video of him scaling the Great Pyramid of Khafre went viral. His newfound fame has not only boosted local tourism but also brought attention to the plight of stray animals in Egypt.
summary: Apollo, a stray dog living at the Giza Pyramids, became an overnight sensation after a video of him scaling the Great Pyramid of Khafre went viral. His newfound fame has not only boosted local tourism but also brought attention to the plight of stray animals in Egypt.

title: Gabon votes 'yes' to new constitution
Germany approves more professional visas amid labour shortage
content: Germany is on track to issue 10% more skilled worker visas in 2024 compared to the previous year. This follows immigration reforms, including the introduction of a points-based system, aimed at addressing labour shortages. The reforms have sparked interest from professionals and students worldwide, with a significant increase in visa applications for work, study, and qualification recognition.
summary: Germany is on track to issue 10% more skilled worker visas in 2024 compared to the previous year. This follows immigration reforms, including the introduction of a points-based system, aimed at addressing labour shortages. The reforms have sparked interest from professionals and students worldwide, with a significant increase in visa applications for work, study, and qualification recognition.

title: Germany to enforce strict knife ban at Christmas markets
content: Germany is increasing security at its Christmas markets this year, enforcing a new ban on sharp weapons following a deadly knife attack in August. Interior Minister Nancy Faeser emphasized 'zero tolerance' for violations, which could result in fines up to €10,000. The ban, part of a larger security package, prohibits knives at large public gatherings.
summary: Germany is increasing security at its Christmas markets this year, enforcing a new ban on sharp weapons following a deadly knife attack in August. Interior Minister Nancy Faeser emphasized 'zero tolerance' for violations, which could result in fines up to €10,000. The ban, part of a larger security package, prohibits knives at large public gatherings.

title: Senegal ruling party claims victory in legislative elections
content: Senegal's ruling PASTEF party, led by President Bassirou Diomaye Faye, has declared victory in the legislative elections. The win solidifies Faye's power after his presidential victory earlier this year. Opposition parties conceded defeat, while former President Macky Sall, leading an opposition group from abroad, alleged fraud without providing evidence.
summary: Senegal's ruling PASTEF party, led by President Bassirou Diomaye Faye, has declared victory in the legislative elections. The win solidifies Faye's power after his presidential victory earlier this year. Opposition parties conceded defeat, while former President Macky Sall, leading an opposition group from abroad, alleged fraud without providing evidence.

title: Mini cars, big thrills: Forget cheese, rats have need for speed
content: Neuroscientist Kelly Lambert and her team at the University of Richmond discovered that rats not only can learn to drive small vehicles but also exhibit genuine enjoyment in the process. The rats, trained using Froot Loops as rewards, displayed excitement and anticipation before driving sessions, suggesting a positive emotional response to operating the vehicles.
summary: Neuroscientist Kelly Lambert and her team at the University of Richmond discovered that rats not only can learn to drive small vehicles but also exhibit genuine enjoyment in the process. The rats, trained using Froot Loops as rewards, displayed excitement and anticipation before driving sessions, suggesting a positive emotional response to operating the vehicles.

title: 'Life be damned': Donald Trump Jr accuses Joe Biden of triggering 'World War III' over US missiles being used by Ukraine
content: Donald Trump Jr alleged that the Biden administration's decision to allow Ukraine to use US missiles within Russia aims to provoke a global conflict before his father, Donald Trump, assumes the presidency in January. Trump Jr argued that the defense industry benefits from war and seeks to undermine his father's peacemaking efforts.
summary: Donald Trump Jr alleged that the Biden administration's decision to allow Ukraine to use US missiles within Russia aims to provoke a global conflict before his father, Donald Trump, assumes the presidency in January. Trump Jr argued that the defense industry benefits from war and seeks to undermine his father's peacemaking efforts.

title: No sunrise in this US town for 64 days! Here's why
content: The town of Utqiagvik, Alaska, formerly known as Barrow, has entered a 64-day period of polar night, with its last sunrise occurring on November 18. This phenomenon, caused by the Earth's tilt, plunges the town into darkness as the sun remains below the horizon for approximately two months each year.
summary: The town of Utqiagvik, Alaska, formerly known as Barrow, has entered a 64-day period of polar night, with its last sunrise occurring on November 18. This phenomenon, caused by the Earth's tilt, plunges the town into darkness as the sun remains below the horizon for approximately two months each year.
